list-item.p: Pronuclear microinjection: This technique is a well-standardized method used in several livestock [ 42]. This technique involves transfer of developmentally competent or transgenic embryos to donor females, thereby causing considerable reduction of cost [ 43, 44].

Embryonic stem (ES) cell manipulation: ES cell manipulation has been used mainly in mice for the deletion of target genes by homologous recombination to describe the function of specific genes but has not been used in other species [ 45]; however, ES-like cells have been used in pigs [ 46- 48].
Other alternative strategies: A prominent approach is transformation of animals using retroviruses [ 49].
Nuclear transfer: In livestock, this sophisticated technique has been employed by the fusion of donor cell with an appropriate unfertilized egg or early embryo which has been enucleated [ 50].
